paper: SpecExtend_ A Drop-in Enhancement for Speculative Decoding of Long Sequences

differences.summary: Speedup definition and notation ambiguity in Equation 1
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines theoretical soundness and interpretability of claimed gains

evidence.baseline_quote: connects τ and latencies to end-to-end speed, justifying focus on both draft speed and accuracy.
evidence.final_quote: Equation 1 labels T_avg^sd/T_t as ‘speedup’; variable d appears but is not defined.

differences.summary: Mixed baselines and inconsistent speedup reporting
differences.why_impacts_score: Confuses comparisons and may exaggerate or misstate improvements

evidence.baseline_quote: details of optimization/hyperparameters for these baselines are not provided.
evidence.final_quote: Mixing baselines (vs AR vs standard) across text, tables, and figures can mislead comparisons.

differences.summary: Contradiction in attention-score extraction and overhead claims
differences.why_impacts_score: Creates uncertainty about implementation requirements and measured overheads

evidence.baseline_quote: Section 3.2.1 explains extracting final-layer attention scores only during verification to avoid full matrix materialization.
evidence.final_quote: Section 3.2.1 states attention scores are obtained with ‘no additional forward passes,’ yet Table 8 shows a small ‘Target Forward w/ Retrieval’ overhead.

differences.summary: Clarity praised in baseline, misreferences flagged in final
differences.why_impacts_score: Reduces clarity and reproducibility, lowering the clarity score

evidence.baseline_quote: Clear motivation and presentation (Figure 1; Section 1; Section 3.1–3.2).
evidence.final_quote: Misreferences impede reproducibility by sending readers to the wrong section.

differences.summary: Final explicitly lowers overall score due to internal consistency issues
differences.why_impacts_score: Explicit rationale ties lower score to theory/reporting inconsistencies

evidence.baseline_quote: Strong empirical gains across tasks and frameworks, but limited output quality evaluation and theoretical depth.
evidence.final_quote: but internal consistency issues in Equation 1, baselines, and reporting reduce interpretability.

differences.summary: Data/reporting issues: duplicated tokens/s and unsupported references
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines confidence in empirical results and comparisons

evidence.baseline_quote: Strong, comprehensive empirical results across tasks, models, and lengths.
evidence.final_quote: Table 2 reports identical tokens/s across distinct target configurations.
